Amiodarone versus beta-blockers for the prevention of postoperative atrial fibrillation after cardiac surgery: An updated systematic review and meta-analysis of randomised controlled trials [version 1; peer review: awaiting peer review] F1000Research 2022, 11:569  First published: 25 May 2022, 11:569  Conclusions: Amiodarone and beta-blockers are equally effective in preventing postoperative atrial fibrillation after cardiac surgery, with no difference in AF episode and duration, mean ventricular rate, and hospital length of stay.
